TypeSignature.Value: Public MustInherit Class AbstractWindowedCursor Inherits AbstractCursor
public ref class AbstractWindowedCursor abstract : Android::Database::AbstractCursor
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AbstractWindowedCursor extends Android.Database.AbstractCursor

Docs.summary: A base class for Cursors that store their data in CursorWindows.

remarks.para: A base class for Cursors that store their data in CursorWindows.

The cursor owns the cursor window it uses. When the cursor is closed, its window is also closed. Likewise, when the window used by the cursor is changed, its old window is closed. This policy of strict ownership ensures that cursor windows are not leaked.

Subclasses are responsible for filling the cursor window with data during #onMove(int, int), allocating a new cursor window if necessary. During #requery(), the existing cursor window should be cleared and filled with new data.
If the contents of the cursor change or become invalid, the old window must be closed (because it is owned by the cursor) and set to null.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: The cursor window owned by this cursor.

remarks.para: The cursor window owned by this cursor.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Sub SetWindow (window As CursorWindow)
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetWindow(class Android.Database.CursorWindow window) cil managed
abstract member SetWindow : Android.Database.CursorWindow -> unit override this.SetWindow : Android.Database.CursorWindow -> unit

Docs.param: The new cursor window, typically a remote cursor window.
Docs.summary: Sets a new cursor window for the cursor to use.

remarks.para: Sets a new cursor window for the cursor to use.
The cursor takes ownership of the provided cursor window; the cursor window will be closed when the cursor is closed or when the cursor adopts a new cursor window.
If the cursor previously had a cursor window, then it is closed when the new cursor window is assigned.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
